channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Sinner battles cramp to claim Vienna Open title
item.description: World number two Jannik Sinner battles cramp to stage a 3-6 6-3 7-5 comeback against Alexander Zverev and claim the Vienna Open title.

item.title: Xu wins singles and doubles titles at Wrexham Open
item.description: Welsh 18-year-old Mimi Xu backs up the biggest singles win of her career by clinching the doubles title just hours later.

item.title: Bencic wins second WTA title since becoming a mother
item.description: Belinda Bencic claims her second WTA title since becoming a mother by beating Linda Noskova in straight sets in the Pan Pacific Open final.

item.title: Zverev sets up rematch with Sinner in Vienna final
item.description: Alexander Zverev and Jannik Sinner win in the Vienna Open semi-finals to set up a rematch of January's Australian Open final.

item.title: Rybakina pulls out of Pan Pacific Open semi-final
item.description: Linda Noskova will face Belinda Bencic in Sunday's Pan Pacific Open final in Tokyo after Elena Rybakina withdraws from the semi-finals with back issues.

item.title: Xu to face Stojsavljevic in Wrexham Open final
item.description: Wales' Mimi Xu secures her place in the final of the Wrexham Open following victory over Lily Miyazaki in an all-British semi-final.

item.title: Sinner wins but host of players retire in Basel
item.description: World number two Jannik Sinner progresses to the semi-finals of the Vienna Open with a dominant straight-set win over Alexander Bublik.

item.title: Rybakina clinches last spot in WTA Finals
item.description: Elena Rybakina clinches the last spot for next month's WTA Finals by reaching the semi-finals of the Pan Pacific Open.

item.title: Saudi Arabia to host new ATP tournament from 2028
item.description: A new ATP Masters 1000 tournament will be added to the tennis calendar from 2028 - and staged in Saudi Arabia.

item.title: What next for Djokovic after Paris withdrawal?
item.description: Novak Djokovic pulling out of the upcoming Paris Masters without giving a reason raises questions about his plans for the rest of the season.

item.title: Norrie beaten by Berrettini in Austria Open thriller
item.description: British number two Cameron Norrie exited the Austria Open last-16 after defeat by Italian Matteo Berrettini in Vienna.

item.title: Xu through to Wrexham Open quarter-finals
item.description: Wales' Mimi Xu books her spot in the Wrexham Open quarter-finals with a straight-sets win over Andre Lukosiute.

item.title: Norrie battles past Rublev to progress in Austria
item.description: Britain's Cameron Norrie overcomes seventh seed Andrey Rublev in three sets to reach the second round of the Erste Bank Open.

item.title: 'My driving test was more stressful than Wimbledon'
item.description: Teenage tennis star Mimi Xu says her driving test was far more stressful than playing Emma Raducanu on her Wimbledon debut.

item.title: Sinner to miss Italy's Davis Cup title defence
item.description: Four-time Grand Slam champion Jannik Sinner will not be part of the Italy team aiming to win a third consecutive Davis Cup title in November.

item.title: Boulter's poor run continues with first-round loss
item.description: British number three Katie Boulter continues her poor run of form with defeat by German Eva Lys in the second round of the Pan Pacific Open.

item.title: Draper & coach Trotman part ways after four years
item.description: Jack Draper will no longer work with the man who coached him to the Indian Wells title as James Trotman wants to prioritise time with his family.

item.title: Resurgent Medvedev wins first title for 882 days
item.description: A resurgent Daniil Medvedev claims his first title for 882 days with victory over Corentin Moutet in the Almaty Open final.

item.title: Rating Raducanu's season - and what does future hold?
item.description: BBC tennis correspondent Russell Fuller looks at how Emma Raducanu's 2025 season went - and what the future could hold.

item.title: Sinner dominates Alcaraz at lucrative Six Kings Slam
item.description: Jannik Sinner claims a commanding victory over rival Carlos Alcaraz to win a reported $6m prize pot at the Six Kings Slam in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

item.title: 'Sport must adapt', says Draper after Rune injury
item.description: Holger Rune becomes the latest high-profile tennis player to have his season ended prematurely after suffering an injury at the Nordic Open in Stockholm.

item.title: Osaka out of Japan Open as tennis casualty list grows
item.description: Grand Slam winner Naomi Osaka withdraws from the Japan Open through injury as tennis players continue to struggle.

item.title: LeBron, Ronaldo, Brady 'inspire' Djokovic to play into 40s
item.description: Novak Djokovic wants to follow sporting greats such as LeBron James, Cristiano Ronaldo and Tom Brady by playing in his 40s and help shape the future of tennis.

item.title: Boulter out of Japan Open in second round
item.description: British number three Katie Boulter wins only four games as she is knocked out of the Japan Open by Sorana Cirstea.

item.title: Players 'misunderstood' over exhibition criticisms
item.description: World number one Carlos Alcaraz says players are misunderstood when they want to play in exhibition tournaments despite criticising the demanding tour schedule.

item.title: Raducanu ends season and will keep coach for 2026
item.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu ends her season early because of illness and agrees a deal with coach Francisco Roig for next season.

item.title: Boulter loses to Pegula as GB out of BJK Cup
item.description: Watch the best shots, as the United States' Jessica Pegula fights back from a set down to beat Katie Boulter and knock Great Britain out of the Billie Jean King Cup at the semi-final stage.

item.title: GB's Kartal runs Navarro close in BJK Cup semi-final
item.description: A battling Sonay Kartal falls to the United States' Emma Navarro, as Great Britain go 1-0 down in the semi-finals of the Billie Jean King Cup.

item.title: Boulter win puts GB into BJK Cup semi-finals
item.description: Watch the best shots, as Katie Boulter's win over Moyuka Uchijima sees Great Britain secure a 2-0 win over Japan, setting up a Billie Jean King Cup semi-final with the United States.

item.title: GB's Kartal dominates Shibahara in BJK Cup match win
item.description: Watch the best shots, as Sonay Kartal beats Ena Shibahara of Japan to give Great Britain a 1-0 lead in their Billie Jean King Cup quarter-final tie.

item.title: Borg will fight cancer 'like it's a Wimbledon final'
item.description: Tennis legend Bjorn Borg says "I hope I'm gonna be OK" after being diagnosed with "extremely aggressive" prostate cancer.

item.title: How will GB cope without Raducanu in BJK Cup?
item.description: Emma Raducanu is missing the Billie Jean King Cup to focus on the WTA Tour.

item.title: Alcaraz overcomes Sinner to win US Open
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz triumphs in the latest chapter of his compelling rivalry with Jannik Sinner, earning a four-set victory to regain the US Open title.

item.title: How can Raducanu close gap on top players?
item.description: Emma Raducanu believes the world's leading stars play her with 'a point to prove' - so what can she do to close the gap?

item.title: Electric New York energy reignites etiquette debate
item.description: Is apologising for a net cord courteous or meaningless? BBC Sport looks at why tennis etiquette is back on the agenda at the US Open.

item.title: The pioneering champion America forgot
item.description: Althea Gibson became the first black player to win a Grand Slam yet she received little recognition during her life. Why?

item.title: From drugs bans to Wimbledon champions - how did we get here?
item.description: Iga Swiatek and Jannik Sinner have won the Wimbledon singles titles having served drugs bans within the past year. Dan Roan explores what it means for tennis.

item.title: 'The first free black man I'd seen' - Ashe's South African legacy
item.description: The tennis champion wanted to be remembered for fighting racism, not just his sporting prowess.

item.title: Speed, movement & anticipation - Alcaraz and the art of court positioning
item.description: Knowing what type of shot to play and when is key to winning matches - so too is court positioning as Carlos Alcaraz shows.

item.title: 'A dream come true' - Alcaraz on winning US Open & reaching world No 1
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz says it's a "dream come true" after winning his second US Open title and regaining the No. 1 spot in the world rankings.

item.title: Sabalenka retains US Open to win first Grand Slam of 2025
item.description: Defending champion Aryna Sabalenka beats American Amanda Anisimova 6-3 7-6 (7-3) to retain the US Open and win her first Grand Slam of 2025, having already lost the Australian and French Open finals earlier this year.

item.title: 'Why would you say that?' - Swiatek unimpressed by reporter's question
item.description: World number two Iga Swiatek challenges a journalist after her US Open defeat against Amanda Anisimova, rejecting the suggestion that she needs a "mental break" after the straight sets loss at Flushing Meadows.

item.title: Anisimova gains revenge on Swiatek for Wimbledon final
item.description: Amanda Anisimova knocks Iga Swiatek out of the US Open, to gain revenge for her 6-0 6-0 defeat in the 2025 Wimbledon final.

item.title: Alcaraz 'owns' new haircut - Raducanu
item.description: Speaking at the US Open, after her second round win, Emma Raducanu said Carlos Alcaraz "owns" his new haircut.

item.title: Raducanu beats Tjen to reach US Open third round
item.description: Britain's former US Open champion Emma Raducanu reaches the third round of this year's tournament with a dominant 6-2 6-1 win against Indonesia's Janice Tjen.

item.title: Williams grateful for US Open chance after health issues
item.description: Venus Williams says it is nice to have had the chance to "play more healthy" after serious health issues despite losing in the first round of the US Open.

item.title: Medvedev smashes racquet after losing chaotic thriller
item.description: Watch the moment Daniil Mededev smashes up his racquet after his first-round defeat by Benjamin Bonzi at the US Open.

item.title: I was upset with decision, not photographer - Medvedev
item.description: Daniil Medvedev says his US Open meltdown was a reaction to the umpire's decision after a photographer walked on to court as he was facing match point.

item.title: Raducanu earns first win at US Open since 2021 title
item.description: Watch mini highlights as British number one, Emma Raducanu beats Japanese qualifier Ena Shibahara 6-1 6-2 to get her first US Open win since 2021.

item.title: What is US Open prize money?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at how much prize money is on offer at the US Open.

item.title: Why is there a pineapple on Wimbledon's men's trophy?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at why there is a pineapple on the top of the Wimbledon trophy for the winner of the men's singles.

item.title: Why were there no line judges at Wimbledon 2025?
item.description: Wimbledon are relying on electronic line calling to judge whether a ball is in or out.

item.title: Why female tennis players returned to Queen's after half a century
item.description: For the first time in 52 years, women will be playing tennis at Queen's - here's why.
